intro: Houstonia montana, commonly known as mountain bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Houstonia montana is often found in mountainous regions and is an important component of the understory vegetation in these habitats.
